element.name: Fuair Cnocs by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)

td.p: This cache is located on the pathway to a 5000 year old megalithic burial mound called "Fuair Cnocs" (meaning The Cold Hills). The mound is similar to Newgrange, but not as big and not as well known; but it is well kept and a very interesting place to visit (and certainly not as touristy as Newgrange is; there is no visitors centre and entrance to the mound is free). There are two other burial mounds very close by (in fact, you can see them from Fuair Cnocs), but unfortunately they are on privately owned land. Fuair Cnocs is located in the beautiful scenery of county Meath, close to a town called Naul; the drive up to the cache along narrow and bendy roads provides some wonderful views over the Irish countryside out to the sea.

The cache is a small size plastic container. For a hint on the how to find it, consult the spoiler photograph (which does not give away too much :-) and optionally check the encrypted hint below.
Please take care when retriving and replacing this cache.

ul.li:
2010-06-02T19:00:00Z : Write note by AbbeyAckbar
Bug drop. - Percy TB. Didn't see Poutnik coin in the cache today.

2010-05-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by abra123cadabra
Nice place. Didn't go for the key today with a dark cloud approaching quickly. Close inspection gave it away, although we expected a different location.
Out: 4 Pfoten GC.

2010-03-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by Mausfallensteller
A nice place out here, unfortunately it was too late to fetch the key, bur I'll come back.
in: A Cache A Day Geocoin out: HH's ounties Geocoin (Replica)
Thank you for showing this place! [;)]
p.s. part of the 'tevc' was freshly broken, I cut it away that it's not that obviously any more.

2009-12-31T20:00:00Z : Found it by zentemätes
Found it with the help of my brother in law and the kids. Dropped a coin and "Poutnik".
TFTC

2009-12-18T20:00:00Z : Found it by AbbeyAckbar
(#596 @ 15:04) Found in the company of my muggle sister. She actually spotted the cache first! The place was empty and not suprisingly, as it was freezing out. There were icicles hanging from the rooftop entrance into the mound! On the drive up to the cache site we spotted a hunt about to get under way in a field close by. All the riders were dressed up and the horses looked great. We'll be back to see inside some time.
SL. TFTC.

wpt.name: GCQAC4
wpt.desc: Fuair Cnocs by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Fuair Cnocs
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Inside the Burial Mound
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This cache is located on the pathway to a 5000 year old megalithic burial mound called "Fuair Cnocs" (meaning The Cold Hills). The mound is similar to Newgrange, but not as big and not as well known; but it is well kept and a very interesting place to visit (and certainly not as touristy as Newgrange is; there is no visitors centre and entrance to the mound is free). The cache is a small size plastic container. For a hint on the how to find it, consult the spoiler photograph (which does not give away too much :-) and optionally check the encrypted hint below.

The Windsockers
